intro: Tagetes heterocarpha, commonly known as the Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has alternate, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for gardeners. The flowers are often used in ornamental gardening and have cultural significance in various regions.
